result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon C Hunt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Brandon C Hunt is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Brandon C Hunt was found guilty of Armed Robbery, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervison or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.

Reporter:  digital recorder - 1:30
  Def waived reading of Information.  Def by Counsel enters a plea of NG.  Motions due w/i 20 days; bail continued.

Defendant in court with Attorney Dennis E. Burke.  Kristin K. Shimabuku appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing signed.
Defn
Atty Burke appointed 02/05/2014
Status conference on March 3, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
  - Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Chad W. or Zachary F.
  - Defendant shall not be at O'Reilly Auto Parts on Stoughton Rd, Madison
  - Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon including fake or facsimile weapons. 
  - Defendant shall be within their residence between the hours of 8 p.m. and 6 a.m., unless at, or traveling to or from, school, treatment, or employment as approved by BMP in writing.
  - The Court finds that cash bond is necessary to assure the defendant's appearance in Court. Cash bond is set in the amount of $10,000.00 per case. If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with DCBM as a condition of the defendant's release. The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. If the defendant fails to comply with Dane County Bail Monitoring. Cash bail is automatically set in the amount of $10,000.00 per case, as higher cash bail is necessary to assure appearance in court. If Defendant posts this higher amount of bail and is released from jail, the Sheriff is directed to notify DCBM. If Defendant is out of custody, supervision by DCBM is required to enforce conditions of release and protect the public.The Defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. Defendant is ordered to cooperate with DCBM.
Defendant waived the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial judge -  Br 2

Defendant in court with Attorney  State Public Defender.  Adrienne Blais appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for March 3, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
